Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Flying M
Reviews.Content: I always want to be in the center of Rome but this is no easy task when you limit yourself in terms of districts and if you do not plan to spend a lot of money but you enjoy clean, safe, and friendly service. I have stayed twice at Homs after trying a few other hotels in Rome, although others are more luxurious, but for the sake of my work trips I know what I am looking for and I found it at this hotel: very friendly and helpful staff, excellent wifi, clean room, good service, fine breakfast, and ofcourse the location is very good, a few steps from the Spanish Steps. The rooms are small but convenient, and do not expect anything out of the ordinary. The TV did not work good, for those who care about that it might be a problem; it is not something I care about in a hotel. This is Rome, so if you want to stay in the city center, expect some noise! I have stayed at two different floors, once on the first floor, and I felt that the noise was more substantial and I felt like the walls separating the rooms were a little thin, but here is a tip- never travel without ear plugs to urban centers! As for the breakfast, the highlight is the cappuccino! The restaurant is good, the bar is nice, and I recommend this hotel for those seeking a convenient hotel in the center of Rome. One last tip, the hallways are long and there are many steps between the different sections of the hotel, pack light!

Reviews.Title: “Primo Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobalConsultant
Reviews.Content: I was "walked" here by the sister hotel, Villa Morgagni, and not happy about it after a long day, but the Homs proved to be a very nice property. Unusual, but comfortable, rooms, with unique bath in each. Very comfortable beds, a good breakfast, nicely kept hotel. Staff was very helpful and, in some cases, absolutely charming.The hotel's location near the Piazza di Spagna and the Via del Corso is convenient with loads of shopping and restaurants nearby. Rooms are priced very reasonably making the Homs a true value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it was a smaller hotel. The location near the Spanish Steps, good shopping, and even within easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain and on to the Colosseum. The staff was friendly, the rates were fair and the room very confortable. We would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JDMTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location just a block away from the Spanish Steps. We arrived late in the day but were greatly warmly and promptly and taken to our rooms. We only stayed overnight, but when I was researching hotels, I was looking for something in a good location, that was a good hotel, and at a reasonable price since I was looking for two single rooms. Well, this lived hotel lived up to the expectations. The hotel is small with a tiny lobby, but it is nicely decorated and clean. The rooms were also very nice and clean. But be warned, there is a reason why single rooms are so cheap here....they are tiny! But, I did know this before I arrived, so it wasn't really a surprise. In fact, most hotel rooms in Europe are pretty small. But single rooms here are about 10 ft x 10 ft. But, if you just want a clean and comfortable place in a great location and don't need to spend a lot of time in your room, this is the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limoncello62
Reviews.Content: Hotel Homs did everything we asked it to -- we had a comfortable stay, the rooms were clean, the staff helpful enough, and the price did not break the bank. But it's the location that is really the star here. Scores of restaurants, bars, gelaterias, pastry shops, and attractions (esp Spanish Steps) all within strolling distance from this hotel. Plus it has a little corner cafe as part of the hotel's corner where we had coffees, biscuits, and champagne. We walked to all locations in downtown Rome, including the Colosseum, the Vatican, and all major Piazzas. Bottom line is we had a blast and the Homs was a nice place to come back to at the end. What more do you need? :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Treat”
Reviews.Author: lynda_spcc
Reviews.Content: We had been inTuscany for a couple of weeks and were ending our trip in Rome. We spent four days at this lovely hotel. It is very convenient to the metro and in a central location. Within a block of the Spanish Steps, it is near many restaurants. It was a pleasant surprise when we entered our hotel room to find they had upgraded us to a suite. It was so nice. We had a private balcony and lovely sitting room with large screen TV and great air conditioning. We could not have been happier in any other hotel. The price was reasonable. We ate at a couple of great restaurants near our hotel. This was our second time to stay at this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, subpar hotel”
Reviews.Author: delphi927
Reviews.Content: Located just a few minutes away from the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti and Via del Corso - we couldn't have asked for a better spot. However, the room was literally the size of a closet - it was the smallest, most uncomfortable hotel room I've ever seen. The full size bed is only a few inches narrower than the room itself, which makes opening your suitcase nearly impossible. The bathroom is a decent size, however, the shower was broken and it kept falling off of the bar/pole - I have a pretty nasty bruise on my wrist from the shower head smashing on to me. I mentioned this to the front desk and rather than attempting to fix it, they just put it back on the pole. The employees at the front desk were all pretty unfriendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler52781
Reviews.Content: Hotel Homs is a nice, clean, modern boutique-style hotel in a prime location in Rome. It's steps away from the Spanish Steps (in one of the most fashionable areas in Rome--think NYC's 5th avenue) and blocks from the Trevi Fountain. We quickly learned that Rome is a completely walk-able city and we were in the heart of it. The hotel is on a busy, well-lit street and we always felt safe walking there, even at night. And even though the streets below were always bustling, we never heard any noise when our windows were closed. From the moment my fiancee and I checked in, Francesca, at the front desk, took care of us; booking restaurant reservations, recommending tours, and making sure our stay was comfortable. Our room was pretty small, but cozy. There was a tiny entrance way and the entire main room was taken up by the bed and 2 night stands. We were able to peek inside other rooms and noticed that ours was definitely one of the smaller ones without much storage space. We had to put our clothes in every little nook imaginable, and we stored our luggage under the bed, as there was no real closet, but we made due. The room was very nicely decorated with a very clean, bright, modern bathroom. The reason I didn't give cleanliness a "5" is because the shower had slight signs of age and what could have been small mold stains on the shower floor. The water pressure in the shower was great though! I also really didn't like that the entire bathroom sink was made of glass, which showed spots and messiness very easily. The room was cleaned every day though and never felt messy or dirty. The bed was large and very comfortable. There was a safe in the room, a fridge, and a flat screen TV. Since we didn't spend much time in the room, it was everything we needed. The hotel has all the modern amenities and a little cafe downstairs. Breakfast wasn't included, but we didn't miss it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: thisgeneration
Reviews.Content: Very attractive, 'boutique-style' hotel right in the heart of Rome. Just by the Spanish steps, surrounded by shops (Including all the names - Prada, Ferragamo etc),hundreds ofrestaurants, and within walking distance of all the major sites. Helpful staff, attractive, clean rooms with mini-bars, and, contrary to what some reviewers have said, we found the room sizes fine. Slight grumble about my own room (Room 208) - hum coming from the electrics panel on the wall (we blotted it sufficiently with a towel). Also, noise from toilet for a long time after flushing (a member of staff stopped it immediately by pressing the flush a couple of times - told this was a temporary fault). Perhaps I should give 3 stars only for that, but my companion's room was fine, and the hotel was so good overall that it deserves 4. Lots of noise from the street when window open, but when closed, I had no problem sleeping (and I'm not someone who sleeps easily in hotels!). Room was lovely and cool (but not too cool) when temperatures were 30 outside.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars?!?! You are Kidding Hotel Homs”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller2569
Reviews.Content: First of all-to make the things clear-It's difficult to judge where the hotel rating comes from and the system used to reward it but it's DEFINATELLY NOT A 4* HOTEL. Nowhere nearer it in fact! 2+ at least unless one believes they are still living in 70's. I can imagine hotels have some freedome in labelling themselves with stars. However I wonder why websites and travel agents including leading, well known companies keep advertising the place as 4* while it is very obvious even for a diletant that it's not! Let me start with positives and there is only ONE-the location. It's a definate advantage of the establishment. About 50metres from Spanish Steps, Via Condotti (where many designer shops are) plus Piazza del Popolo, Trevi fontain, presidential palace, Forum, Capitoline Hill all within easy reach. It is even more difficult to overlook the hotel location when compare it to Termini station (not very pleasant and unwelcoming area) where a large number of hotels geared for tourists are situated. Now to negatives-as with majority of hotels in Rome (and Italy) the average quality and standards of accomodation are somewhat below of that found elsewhere in Europe. There is a continuos inflow of tourists to Italy guaranteeing bookings to owners and it seems that very little efforts are put to update hotels to comtemporary standards. The rooms in Homs are extremely tiny, more like student sleep place than a 4* HOTEL. Public areas look old and in desperate need of refurbishing (although a bathroom in my room showed some signs of being partially upgraded). It seemed that reception staff had no training of dealing with visitors whatsoever-upon my arrival there was no greeting, no smile-in fact one of the ladies at the reception had such an expression on her face as though she were about to punch someone on the face...One would get a feeling that hotel employees treat visitors not as guests deserving at least basic level of service but rather like unavoidable inconvenience. I guess one would have difficulties to believe that in high season that establishment charges well over £100.00 for tiny room! Needless to say-breakfast not included. I would say that the place is only good for those who simply wishes to use it as a base for exploring many magnificient monuments and sites of Rome. For all others who also look for a decent service, care and confort the place should be avoided. One more word of caution-there is a cafe on the corner, 10m away from hotel entrance (to the left) the same way leading to Spanish Steps. Avoid it at all cost! Can't even be called a tourist trap. It's much worse than that. Prices for drinks and food in central Rome are not particularly cheap. However in that establishment they will charge you twice of already highly inflated prices (i.e. 550ml bottle of Coke costs £2.50 on average, you will pay £4.50 there for pleasure to be served by a cashier who tries to deal with customers while chatting to some one on mobile)... To conclude the hotel is a very poor value for money with employees who hardly cares about visitors. On another hand Rome is a great city to visit, where history awaits you on every corner. Also perhaps sunny, blue skies and warm weather make it so much easier to forget negatives of Homs and remember the Eternal City. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst we stayed in - a waste of money in an area with a ton of competition... go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Skigirl25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, but the room was messy, cleaning staff was sloppy, the beds were uncomfortable, front desk was UNHELPFUL, their website oversold their wifi/breakfast and didn't provide either (well they did at unreasonable extra costs) and we were put into a smoking room after requesting non! ew! Alright onto the review: we visited Rome as part of our Honeymoon tour from Northern Italy all the way down ending in Rome. I booked Hotel Homs because the reviews were all so positive and I really wanted to cap off the trip in a wonderful, luxurious way. Instead I got jack hammering outside my window until 4am, no joking. Let me start with check in - we arrived to the hotel after walking from the train station (not advisable, but we were happy doing it) and since we were back packing it, we clearly had big ugly back packs on. The hotel front desk actually made fun of us for back packing on our honeymoon. Really?! The room was spacious and clean but the paint was all marked up and uncared for, the bathrooms weren't clean and the shutters were broken. The room was a smoking room and we're non smokers so we noticed an unpleasant odor right away. The walls were also paper thin and we could hear everything that was going on in the LOUD room next door - I believe every screaming child in Rome was in that room. Yay honeymoon! We were on the road for 3 weeks so naturally I wanted to touch base with family and friends on the Wifi only to discover it cost 5 euros/hour!?! When you advertise wifi available it should be free or reasonably priced! It was also a bummer to realize that when they said breakfast available it wasn't part of the package like they made it sound. Their breakfasts started at 20 euros each. When you're paying as much as they cost, that was a shock. We decided to go out and check out the sights right away and asked the front desk for advice - she circled one district on the map and sent us on our way - really, there's only one area to see in Rome? good thing we had a good travel book with us. That night we went down to purchase some internet time only to discover the night clerk didn't understand English. I know it's not expected - but in a 4 star hotel I thought we would be pretty safe to bet english would be spoken. The next night is when bad went worse - construction started outside our window. No joke they were jack hammering directly below our window all night long. When we went downstairs to ask what time they were expected to stop the front desk clerk said 2am ish and that it wasn't his fault. I understand they have little control over it - BUT they should have warned us when we checked in! OR since we were a honeymoon couple who booked ages in advance maybe put us on the quiet side of the hotel?? Not just say not our fault... it's not like we were saying it was... we just wanted to know if there was light at the end of the jack hammering tunnel - which btw went on until 4am for three days running - we had little to no sleep the entire time we were there. For $200/night I would expect to 1. be able to sleep at night, 2. have access to the internet, 3. have a little help getting orientated in the city and a nice to have would be at least a coffee and pastry in the morning. Oh well, you live, you learn - cheap sometimes is the way to go!! OH and airport transfer is $50 euros! Ouch! (we were also

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near the spanish stairs”
Reviews.Author: ilanit
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed in the hotel during the last weekend. The hotel location is excellent, 200 meters from the spanish steps and very close to most of Romes attractions. There are a lot of restaurants near by the hotel at walking distance. Avoid the ice creame shop at the end of the hotels street via del vitte, on the way to the spanisg steps, they are theives, taking 16 Euros for ice cream cap,just avoid. The rooms in the hotel are not too big, but well equipt and with good atmosphere. The hotel stuff are very helpfull and freindly , what ever we asked them the helped us. I defently recommed on that hotel it was a very pleasant stay in rome .

Reviews.Title: “Loation, location, location. And a nice bath!”
Reviews.Author: Gunnargutten
Reviews.Content: Actually chose this hotel by checking with Trip Advisor, We arrived with train+ taxi from the cruice terminal in Civitaveccia (maiden voyage for Celebrity Silhouette). Kind of cool when the taxi have to pass all the tourist at the Spanish Steps to get to the hotel. (150 mtr.) LOBBY; Small, but quite OK for Rome. Nice bar / cafe in the proximity. Service professional but not very welcoming. Room not ready (13.30 PM), but they handled the luggage, we went outside for lunch... NEARBY: Just step outside, and you are in one of the most charming streets/arias of Rome. Small restaurants in the streets, so narrow cars have to bend their rear view mirrors just to get by. The ones that doesn't hit you in the back of your head, while eating your pasta!/pizza! Quite fun, but after 3-4 hits you kind of get a headache... Lots of shops with the best brands around the corner (Gucci, Prada, D&G, +++ ALL of them.. ROOMS: Quite good, especially the bath. We had a room with 2 bedrooms (Flat screens in both), a really nice, big bath. VERY QUIET, we did not hear any noise at all! Our room was towards the inside, but even if to the streets I suspect not too much noise, due to traffic/narrow roads. 4-star everything else. (minibar, slippers, shampoo etc.) VERDICT: Must be one of the best located hotels in Rome. You can walk to everywhere; we had 2 kids, and walked to all famous places in Rome. For shopping; don't bring your wife; very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great value in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: BMDM2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Homs for the Rome leg of our Honeymoon. We were very pleasantly surprised at how cute the hotel was. The staff upgraded us to a Honeymoon suite which had a private balcony and over looked the city! It was beautiful. Yes the hotel is small but it's very cute and very clean. The staff is also very friendly. The best part about the hotel is that it is in the best location, we walked everywhere from our hotel. The area is perfect for people that really want to enjoy and get to know Rome. We would stay at the Homs again and we found the pricing to be a value in a city that is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “This is the new Gem of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: richochez
Reviews.Content: Hotel Homs appears to be recently refurbished and is truly the new gem of Rome. The rooms are beautiful and finely furnished. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location in in the midst of the major attractions, Trevi. Pantheon, Coliseum and Vatican City. Restaurants of all types are plentiful within walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jeff3805
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children. The room size was ok. The room was clean. There were 2 flat screen TVs.We had a large balcony and spent several evenings drinking good wine and watching the crowds. The Hotel is in a very good location not far from the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. There are many restaurants nearby. The staff could have been more friendly and helpful. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Clean Rooms, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rbach
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location in Rome. You really cant find a much better location in this city. The hotel is newly updated and very clean. The rooms and bathrooms are moden and comfortable. The breakfast is Very expensive. Don't eat here. Walk a block or 2 in either direction and eat breakfast at a cafe for about 1/3 the price. I will stay here again on my next trip to rome.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELAGNT
Reviews.Content: I work for a US based travel service and stayed at this hotel May 2011. This hotel claims to be a four star business. This is absolutely FALSE! The only decent thing for this hotel is its location. Anyone who believes this hotel warrents a four star rating may never had stayed in an actual four star. I have stayed in over 100 hotels while in Europe and this hotel and its staff are a bad choice if your truly looking for four star accomadations. Lets start off with the room. It was dingy, the paint was peeling, the bedding was unclean, the bathroom was so heavily limed over that the fixtures had difficulty moving. Some of the fixtures were cracked. All furniture in the room was extremely worn and stained. The wall trim was loose and cracked. The wood floors had dark water stains throughout the room. The A/C worked intermittenly. The WI-FI was only obtainable from the lobby not from the room as advertised and their server authentication worked intermittenly, also it was way over priced for 5 euro a hour. The view from the room was a pleasant view of actual garbage. There is a reason that this hotel request payment in advance, that is so when you complain, they already have your money. The hotel staff is poorly trained and is unable or unwilling to address any of your concerns. We have contacted our travel consortium and will be removing this hotel from any positive listings. The truly are one of the worst hotels that claim to be a four star in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SJGC_2010
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly. Make the best coffee in Rome! Would recommend this hotel. This hotel is located around the corner of Spanish Steps. Book on line directly with the hotel it is the best value. The rooms were spacious for European standards. I really enjoyed being able to open the windows on looking down the side streets watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, lovely clean rooms, helpful staff - a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MiLadyFrancesca
Reviews.Content: We simply loved the location and walked everywhere from here. Outside our window we watched cafe life pass by and dined in the many cafes along this quiet cobbled street. We need transfers and they were organised smoothly. We needed internet and we used the lobby PC a few times with success. Unfortunately the room TVs didn't have any English channels but we were too busy either sightseeing, eating or sleeping anyway. We recommend this hotel if you simply need somewhere safe and convenient to many attractions. Rome is so easy and beautiful to walk around and get lost in. Oh and there's a great gelateria on the corner and lots of great restaurants and shopping nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Small-ish room, stand up shower but great location”
Reviews.Author: MissLizaNYC
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Homs on the venere.com website...I was looking for something centrally located that had a hairdryer(my mom insisted on hairdryer) and was clean..as well as value priced...needless to say, value-priced in Rome is hard to find. I was not at all disappointed with Hotel Homs..we stayed 2 nights in Rome and the location was perfect for seeing the sights - close to Spanish Steps and great shopping (for designer-style Gucci, Max Mara, Dolce and Gabanna etc..all around. Rooms were typical European small but they were clean - bathrooms were sparkling - and minibar well-stocked. Note: This hotel does not include breakfast- however, you can have the Italian breakfast at the cafe downstairs for 6 Euro (coffee and croissant). They have internet access at a public computer in their lobby...5 euro per hour..ask at the front desk. I thought the hotel was a bit overpriced but I would recommend it for short stay, clean, great location.

Reviews.Title: “We were coming back”
Reviews.Author: DieterHoffmann
Reviews.Content: We go every year at least once to Rome and have tried out different hotels and looked obvouisly also after the prices as hotels in Rome are very expensive. As we want to stay in the city and close to the shopping area etc, we have tried several hotels close to the Piazza Espania in different categories. We went back to the hotel homs. Its clean, the rooms are nice, the service friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hotel Homs”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel055
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not perfect, but worked out really well for what I needed- very short walk to Spagna metro station, well located for walkign all over the city center including Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colisseum, Pantheon, tons of restaurants and shopping. My room was facing the street and so it was noisy and the hotel rooms are close together so you can hear your neighbor's doors slamming at night. The area seemed to be pretty safe for walking around in the evening. Honestly i didn't interact with the desk staff much b/c i knew what i wanted to see and do. I also recommend Roman Candle walking tours. Enjoy Rome! I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel???? What happened to the other 3 stars during our stay???”
Reviews.Author: SUSANBOOTH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel on the last leg of our vacation. Looking at the reviews on trip advisor, I decided to stay at this hotel! The claim from the hotel is that they are considered a 4 star hotel and the price they charge reflects that! The reality, however, is different. The pictures that are posted are extremely inaccurate. The rooms were not only small, but were old and dingy. The first night we checked in the air conditioning in the room was broken. When we called down to the reception desk, their response "the windows won't open?". A bell hope was eventually sent to the room. He had as much knowledge on what was wrong with the A?C as we did. We were told the maintence guy would not be available until the next day. Needless to say we spent a sleepless night with the windows open to a very noise street below! Our compensation...an Italian breakfast(croissant and a coffee). This was the most expensive hotel during our 17 days in Italy and with out a doubt the worst. So...when in Rome...don't stay at Hotel Homs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILydt
Reviews.Content: Great location... Room was comfortable. Bathroom was clean and shower worked well. TV did not work but then again I wasn't there to watch TV...

Reviews.Title: “A HORRIBLE HOTEL TO AVOID AT ALL COST. NOTHING WORKS”
Reviews.Author: mundotraveler7
Reviews.Content: The room I had was tiny. Neither the television nor the shower worked. The shower head was broken. The mattress sloped like a hill on the tiny and uncomfortable bed. The hotel was the rip-off of the age at 120 Euros a night with no breakfast. I moved to another hotel after two nights to another hotel in the same neighborhood that was wonderful and only 100 Euros a night with breakfast buffet included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mspdan
Reviews.Content: Two adults and two girls 15/18 stayed in a junior suite (room 412) on the inside of the hotel. The weather was perfect so we had the windows open. The loudest noise we heard were the pigeons cooing. Smallish but acceptable size room. My wife and I slept on a pull out in a seperate room. Nice bathroom with towel warmer. Rooms were very clean. Spotless. Great location, take advantage of the McCafe around the corner for breakfast as it is not included. Very helpful staff. Only complaint was the lack of WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lamberse
Reviews.Content: Very tiny rooms, but who cares???? Even the staff were so busy to pay attention to us, but again....who cares??? The location was so great and everything was very clean and quite. We would stay there again, I hope someday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLM55
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the location was perfect. It is a small hotel. The staff was friendly. Some of the front desk clerks were better than others. Otherwise a great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeslieP3
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about a block away from the Spanish Steps and Metro stop, 15 minutes to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona, about a 40 minute walk to the Colliseum (you could take the Metro but why?) and the Vatican. The room was on the small side but I didn't care. I was only there to sleep anyway! There's a cafe on the main level where you can get your morning espresso(s) and a pastry before you head out for the day. The staff was very friendly and spoke enough English so communication was not a problem. Would go back in a heartbeat. Bella Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket03
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with easy access to all major tourist attractions and great restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Location great - front desk service not so great.”
Reviews.Author: ReeniBee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Homs for 4 nights for our 25th anniversay. The location is the best thing about this hotel. It is close to the Spanish Steps, the metro and many other attractions. The downfall of the hotel is the front desk staff could care less about giving you good service. They must get many of the same tourist type questions asked daily of them and yet could have cared less about answering. A common response was I don't know or they couldn't help. I don't know if it was because we were American but we certainly were not demanding guests. They did however hold our luggage on the last mornig we were there. The rooms however were nice and clean and everything was in working order.

Reviews.Title: “Extrememly rude staff and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: katiederik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent several weeks in Europe and this hotel was the very worst part of our trip. The staff is rude and indifferent. They don't even bother to look up from their computers when you walk in. We asked for multiple recommendations or directions to places and each time the directions were wrong and their selections just show that they blatantly do not care about you or your enjoyment. I could have overlooked the awful staff if the room was nice, but you had to roll over the bed to get from the bedroom to the door b/c it is THAT small. And we stayed in lots of small hotels in Europe... this one was ridiculous. Bottom line, unless you want to feel bad about yourself when you leave your hotel... stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Wierd Smell”
Reviews.Author: dcc01
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Clean and safe and fairly quiet. Close to all the sights. 5 min walk to Spanish Steps. 10 min to Trevi Fountain, 25 min walk to Colloseum. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Just one problem: The air conditioning venting in our room blew out a bad smell into the room. We called the smell "dirty diaper". We ended up running the a/c and keeping the windows open. It was evident that they knew about the problem because there was an air freshener plugged into the wall. This was the only drawback, though. Also, had to purchase internet time in advance (pay 5 euros to front desk to get password for one hour of time ) Otherwise, a great hotel in a superior location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Kikka109
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having spent 4 nights on room-only basis at Hotel Homs just off the Spanish Steps. The location is excellent being walking distance from most museums, attractions, shops and restaurants. As for the hotel itself which is attractive, we were given a room on the second floor overlooking a narrow street. The room was small however nicely furnished and very clean and included a flat screen TV. The same can be said for the bathroom which was of a high standard of cleanliness and must have been recently refurbished. We tried breakfast at the hotel which was very good though a little pricey for a coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice and 2 croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great sized room, clean and safe!”
Reviews.Author: gianninijrn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Homs is located about 1 block from the Spanish Steps and the most exclusive place to shop in Rome. Not to mention, there are tons of places to eat for every meal right around the corner. My husband and I had a great experience there, the staff was very responsive and willing to help with any need. In fact, when we arrived our air conditioning wasn't really doing the trick - and the porter came up immediately and fixed it for us! First off, location is fantastic. You honestly could not pick a better location. Our room, # 101, was convenient as we did not have to take the Lift (it fits only 2 people) instead we were able to take the 1 flight of stairs (a plus!) Only negative is that we had a luxurious view of an air conditioning system and alley way. Which normally I would not want, but we were out walking around all day, home to shower and sleep, and that was it! So, I wasn't missing the view. Plus, even the rooms with a view only looked out onto a narrow street with nothing remarkable to look at. Trust me - you're not missing anything if you don't have a view. Plus, if you go to the top floor of the hotel, there is a public outdoor area were there are tables to bring your own wine/food and sit for the night and relax. The room itself was comfortable. Bed was cozy and comfortable. Small office/changing room. Bathroom was large (this is room 101), although it does have a narrow-ish hallway within to get to the toilet and sink. But, this actually makes your room feel larger. Shower had excellent water pressure! There was a flat screen TV, but unless you plan on only watching MTV in Italian overlayed over English speaking people you may not want to turn it on. We listened to a LOT of Italian... which did not help our Italian while we were there though! There is no English channel on the TV, and at first I didn't mind, but once we continued on our travels elsewhere I realized how nice it was to hear your own language when you are in your room! A PLUS... the breakfast bar downstairs. I think I had the best cafe latte's of my life down there! And trust me... I know good coffee! I'm borderline obsessed! Also, they do have an option for breakfast in the morning from 7 - 11 as part of your hotel deal. We did not do this, as the breakfast bar allowed me to get coffee, fresh OJ, and a pastry every morning. This is not a place for a full breakfast of eggs, toasts or even fruit (not really an option anywhere in europe actually). I ended up buying yogurts at local markets and fruit to alternate with the constant pastries being consumed. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. I'm happy to say that this was the beginning of our trip to Italy and had an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return our cancellation charge”
Reviews.Author: unitedflyerboston
Reviews.Content: Despite two lengthy attempts by Diners Club and a final email plea from me, the hotel refuses to return the charge they made to my credit card despite my canceling the reservation weeks in advance on their web site and calling the hotel several days before the date. I have no idea if its a nice hotel or not, but their intransigence in returning my $630 will guarantee I never find out.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem - immaculate rooms, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireLottie
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for a short break in Rome. Yes, our room was small (as they often are in European cities) but was nicely decorated and absolutely spotless - cleaned every day to a very high standard. The bathroom was a good size (including bath), and well stocked with a large variety of toiletries. The location of the hotel is also excellent; in a safe neighbourhood very close to the Spanish Steps and within easy walking distance of virtually everywhere else you could wish to visit while sightseeing in Rome (we did not use taxis or public transport once). There is a pleasant bar/restaurant within the hotel, busy with locals which we liked, but I recommend a small cafe on the same street (turn right out of hotel) for a true Italian breakfast and welcome. Hotel staff were very helpful and were happy to make various telephone calls on our behalf e.g. table reservations, airport taxi etc. All in all a wonder ful stay - would definitely stay here again if we are ever lucky enough to return to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Snobby Concierge and VERY Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SJMcLeod
Reviews.Content: Upon reading several reviews of this property I think our expectations were set a bit too high. The Hotel's best feature is it's location -- a block from the Spanish Steps and in a fun cafe restaurant area. However, the Concierge was snobby and unapproachable. And the hotel room was very average. If you are looking for a 3 star property with a good location Hotel Homs is a good bet. Signed, SMcLeod

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: parisrome2008
Reviews.Content: I booked the reservation online through their website. For the price we paid 550 euros per night, for 5 nights, we expected excellent service. We booked the Trinita De Monti Suite de luxe and were happy with it - two flatscreen TVs, modern bathroom. However, since there were 4 of us, we needed the extra bathroom and inquired about the apartment. We were told the rate was depending on the number of people and were surpised to be quoted rates lower than the rate (300- 450 euros)we paid for the suite deluxe. But when they checked our current rate, we were told they would give us the apartment for the same rate we were paying. We transferred and expected better accomodations. The apartment is really big but is not as modern as the suite deluxe. One bathroom is old and the toilet always clogged up. The TV in the master bedroom is an old TV that could not get any english channel. Several outlets were not working and caused the breaker to trip. We called the fromt desk several times to have our concerns fixed and were brushed off, saying they had to wait for the engineer. Until we left three days later and numerous follow up,, some of our concerns were still not taken care of. . Because of this, I do not think it is a 4 star hotel. There was no strong effort to address the concerns of the guest..

Reviews.Title: “FAB Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MissJayLondon
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with this hotel last minute , wasn't sure what to expect. Turned out to be an excellent hotel, with a brilliant location, walked to almost all the sites, which is great as you'll save money. If your a lover of shopping and love big name brands the location of this hotel is fab is around the corner from Gucci etc. The Hotel was great, i had a double room which was an ok size as was bathroom. Service was good, staff were polite and happy to help when requested although made no real attempt to get to know us or really speak to us otherwise. Overall great hotel would stay there again. Just a quick note, was very expensive as a city in terms of food and drinks would recommend you buy e.g. large bottles of water etc from a local shop tucked away from the main tourist points as this should save you money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! A must if in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaMD
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome and want to be within walking distance of the best attractions & shopping then stay here! It is clean, beautiful, and in the center of it all! We only stayed here for 2 nights (because we were on an organized Globus tour beforehand & had only 2 free days) but when I come back to Rome I will definitely stay here! The hotel staff were very helpful, the AC worked (important in August!) and you were just steps away from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps & the best shopping Rome has to offer. Not to mention countless restaurants. I loved this place. Would recommend it to all of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in OUTSTANDING location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy90230
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location of this hotel. As a young female traveling alone, the neighborhood was very important and this hotel is in a great one! I never took a taxi/metro and walked everywhere. 3 minutes to Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain; 25 minutes to Vatican; 15 minutes to Colisseum; 15 minutes to Pantheon; 20 minutes to Trastevere. I did do a lot walking. The staff at night was friendlier than the day staff. The night guy (Gianluca) even let me print my tour confirmation on the reception computer and another guy helped me with airport directions. My room (single) was small by American standards but if you travel in Europe at all, you'll see it is standard. It was spotlessly clean and had a standing shower, nice bathroom and toiletries provided, too. Downside is it's a bit noisy at night, but I slept with earplugs. If you're planning on sight seeing and using the hotel mainly for sleeping, like I did, then this is perfect. If you want to lounge in the hotel all day, then I'd suggest picking another one. There's even a grocery store around the corner and I had a small fridge in my room I used for snacks/fruit I bought. If you are traveling with kids or tons of lugagge, take the €60 taxi from airport to the hotel. But otherwise, the train/metro is the way to go at about €13 total. It's a little tricky: From the airport (FCO), head toward sign Stazione FS which is down an escalator before exiting the airport building. Take that to the train station and buy your ticket at the counter to Termini metro. You'll be on the train for about 30 minutes and once you arrive at the train stop, exit the station and head right up the street toward the "M". Once you're in Termini, head down the escalator to the A line towards "Battistini". Buy your ticket at the kiosk. Exit at Spagna and once you're out, head left down the street (Spanish Steps will be on your left), then after about 1 or 2 blocks, make a right on Via Della Vite and hotel is on your right. Enjoy Rome - I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Shokan77
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Homs. Just a couple of 100 meters from the Spanish Steps, this hotel was excellently located and full of character. True my room was tiny and at times, the sound on the streets outside sometimes made it hard to get to sleep but the room was spotlessly clean and the staff unfailingly courteous. It is a very reasonably priced option in the Historical centre for someone looking at a mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Homs”
Reviews.Author: gingersnap1011
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in the best location,around the corner from the Spanish steps and a short walk to the Trevi fountain, We found the Hotel very quaint and clean with a nice cafe where we had breakfast every morning. We had the executive room which had a queen size bed ,nicely decorated and very clean. A pretty bathroom with bathtub, shower. This Hotel is located in the heart of old Rome near all the attractions and plenty of restaurants all in walking distance. The staff was very helpful and quick to respond to any needs. We would go back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true Gem”
Reviews.Author: hansjheller
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel and location! We have learned in 50 years of travel to aim for the best central location you can get for the price. This hotel is just perfectly situated. You can walk everywhere. No car necessary. Rome is our favourite city in the world. We have stayed in the hotel 2 times. Its not pretencious. And has been significantly upgraded. We had clean quite rooms. Which is all we wanted. Breakfast on the roof terrace was always brilliant. The views of the Roman roofs was magnificant. There is a little appartment too if you want it. When in Rome stay here! You can not beat the location. Minutes from the Spanish steps and Trivi fountain. Wow. And watch the movie Roman holiday before you come (with Audry Hepburn & Gregory Peck) - then you'll know exactly what sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: WaikikiWahine
Reviews.Content: This is in a fabulous, upscale location on a pedestrian only street two blocks from the Spanish Steps & Via Condotti (Rome's Rodeo Dr). Hotel was recently remodeled but rooms are very small by American standards, average by European standards. Our party had 3 rooms and all the layouts were completely different. Generally very clean but there were dust bunnies on the wooden floors in our room. Sickly orange air freshner was installed to try to mask an odd sewage odor in our corner of the building. Front desk staff speak English. They can be very helpful or not depending on who is on duty. Be careful - I suspect they get kick backs from steering you to certain restaurants because they never would give you a recommended restaurant's name or phone number and insisted on calling in the reservation themselves. Although this was a mixed bag you would have a hard time finding better value for money in this prime tourist area. They run an adjacent restaurant which looked good but seemed pricey. No breakfast was included with our rate.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest management”
Reviews.Author: nomadica
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, one an executive suite and one a normal room. The executive suite was brand new, but the doors to the rooftop terrace wouldn't lock, and hotel management could not care less. The normal room was cramped. Advertised Internet access was non-existent since there wasn't actually a working RJ-45 socket in the room. Front desk staff were clueless and kept insisting that it had one. After a couple of days, the hose literally fell off the handheld shower head in the executive suite. It looks to have been glued on to the head after some prior problem. Front desk staff and management insisted that it must have been our fault, instead of apologising for the inconvenience of our not having a working shower anymore. What's more, they wanted EUR 200 to fix/replace the head. Honestly, we suspect that it is just a scam to get additional $$ out of travelers whom don't typically have the time to argue this with the front desk staff, etc. Fishy as hell, smells like a tourist trap of sorts. The pictures of the rooms etc. look much nicer than the reality of the place. We definitely won't be staying there again, nor will we recommend this place to anybody else.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Clean & Newly Refurbished Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PPS100
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (2 male students) stayed at the Hotel for 5 nights (2 rooms). The Hotel is very close to all major attractions as it is close to the Spanish Steps. The rooms were clean and tidy and newly refurbished. Our room on the 3rd floor had a funny smell to it and they moved us immediately. They are still finishing the outside redecoration as I write this. We had no problems with the hotel, the staff were courteous, knowledgable and helpful. They have a cafe within the hotel that serves breakfast which is a little pricey (euro 15 each) but o.k. They also have a shuttle service to/from the airport which was also useful. Overall a nice hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; small but nice room”
Reviews.Author: Nieroda
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location (around the corner from Spanish steps). Nice room, though very small. You'll walk all day in Rome so this is all you need -- a comfortable bed to collapse in. The cafe on the first floor made the best espresso drinks I've had :-) There was some construction going on out front but the windows did a reasonable job of blocking noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: DADeetz
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value. In a town where hotels are ridiculously expensive, this one was a gem. 4 stars, and worth it. We paid about 120 euros, which for this time of year was a steal. Hotel location is prime for Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, and shopping and food. It is on an alley, like most hotels, and a little hard to find if you are driving. I dropped my car off in Rome the day we got there, so I'm not sure what parking arrangements could be made, but I know that street parking in Rome is out of the question. This hotel was very, very nice. Clean, well appointed, with wonderful bathroom and showers. A/C was perfect, and the beds were wonderful, or, we were just tired and slept well. We had a triple executive room. It was ample size with a pull out chair hide a bed for our son, we had plenty of room even with the bed made up. It is about a 1/2 mile walk to the colliseum and forum, but very easy and flat. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They answered every question that we asked and everyone spoke English very well.

Reviews.Title: “Location great for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kar775
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights at Homs hotel with two friends - it was challenging to find rooms in Rome that would accomodate three people... this property was available, affordable, and advertised a triple rate. We booked an "executive triple", but upon arrival it seemed more like a nice double with a rollaway bed added in the corner. The room was not spacious (but not many hotels in Rome would be, I suppose!), especially with the rollaway bed, but the room was decorated nicely and was clean... and since I slept in the rollaway bed, I can say it wasn't terrible, although I wouldn't have wanted to sleep in it for more than a couple days. The bathroom seems to have been recently renovated - stylish and clean, but a bit cramped. The hotel staff were average - not rude, but definitely did not go above and beyond to impress us. The hotel has a small cafe/bar attached to the lobby, where we enjoyed a capuccino one afternoon. The best thing about this hotel is its location - just around the corner from the Spanish Steps, close to the metro to get around the city, but also lots to discover on the side streets in the area. If you are going to see the sites of Rome and looking for a convenient, nice and clean place to sleep, the Homs Hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for your money”
Reviews.Author: Lex2007
Reviews.Content: We booked one room thru Expedia and another room thru the Hotel Website. Both turned out great! Prior to our trip, after reading all other negative reviews, we were worried. At one point, we thought of cancelling the reservation but we are glad that we did not. It turned out better than expected. The location was excellent! Easy access (walking distance) to all the historical sites, restaurants, and shopping. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, especially the evening/night receptionist. The room was clean and comfortable too. We love their roof patio; it was nice to come back in the evening to relax after a long day of walking. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: PharmaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homs for three nights this week and after some apprehension from other reviews about renovation going on, I was happy to find that it is either finished or well hidden. The hotel is on a small street a few minutes walk from Piazza di Spagna (the Spanish Steps) so the location is near perfect. If you like to walk you are well within distance of almost anywhere (10 min to Trevi Fountain, 20 minutes to Piazza Navona, 30 minutes to Piazza Venezia...). There is a metro station at Spagna and several busses on the Corso and Tritone - all a few minutes away. Although we arrived early we got our room (#107) a few minutes later. Although on the first floor the elevator was helpful. The room - a triple - was modern, clean and cozy and the bathroom (tub and shower) was just fine. The hotel staff were very kind and helpful at all times of the day or night. Two slight disappointments were having no breakfast included and having to pay for wireless internet. There is a great little bar just across the street for drinks and food and plenty of places to eat nearby. The price was a bit too high but if you want location in Rome, you have to pay. I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Locaton, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MICDBsAs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (57 and 56 years old, married for 35 years) stayed at the Homs May 15, 16 and 17. Excellent location. Has just been renewed. Very clean and new. Rooms are small, but very neat. Bathroom is brand new and very very clean. Also very small. At the reception Elias was specially helpful. The rest of the staff also very nice and helpful. Loved this hotel, we are travelling to Rome at the end of June and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo71
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location, as you are in walking distance of all of Rome's attractions. The rooms are small but perfectly formed, just right for a weekend break. The hotel is currently being redecorated, but this didn't affect us (in fact, our room was newly decorated with a shiny new bathroom). I'd certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “building work”
Reviews.Author: darbyshire
Reviews.Content: very expensive.building work all over-not informed about this.looking foreward to roof garden--full of concrete. stayed one night only. then moved to the hotel city---where they were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: AlanDives
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for May 4-12, 2007 through [--], where the hotel advertised that it has air conditioning, which is very important to me. I requested a quiet room both through [--] and a follow-up phone call. This request was ignored, so I changed rooms when I arrived so that my window faced the back. The major problem was that the A/C throughout the hotel was not activated. Thus, I had to sleep with the window open. The nighttime noise was mostly from feral cats carrying on and from a loud TV from an adjoining building; it kept me up most nights. When I complained about the lack of A/C, the manager told me that "none of the hotels in the area" had their A/C systems activated due to some governmental regulation about electrical capacity. It sounded like BS. I stopped in at two other hotels in the area and both had working A/C! When I reported this to the hotel mgr, he admitted that "some of the hotels in the area" indeed had their systems on. I think the hotel owner was just trying to save on overhead expenses and deliberately misrepresented the hotel on the Web. I could have changed hotels, but didn't want to take a half day out of my typically busy tourist schedule to do that. I just had enough of the sleepless nights, left a day early, and ended up getting one free night as compensation, which in my opinion was totally insufficient. The location of the hotel was very good and the non-management staff was very nice and helpful, but I would encourage anyone not to book a room there based on management's dishonesty, the owner's cheapness, and the hotel's innaccurate representation on the Web.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room ,unconcerned staff!”
Reviews.Author: Maximusgattimus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome after 5 long nights at this hotel.DO NOT book the Roof-top apartment (sleeps up to 8)advertised on their website. Not on the roof top is the least of your problem.The hotel has bought an apartment next door. Rooms were unfinished, drywall showing in several places, smoke smell everywhere,no storage,bathroom dirty and scaffolding outside the window and no electricity in the bathroom plugs. The safe in the closet was not secured to the wall, so you could just pick it up and walk off with it!!! When we brought our strong concerns to the Manager at the front desk, her and her staff had no ideas about the issues and conditions of the apartment they were renting. They told us "They assumed the construction was done"!!! and never checked the place. After walking up with us, they seemed surprised but not too shocked. Our 1st choice was to leave the place but we were travelling with children and it would have been very tough to find a place for the 6 of us at the last minute. We had no choice but to stay. They apologized without much sincerity and offered a minimal discount and free breakfast.We were just disgusted. Not even close to be a 4*, may be a 2* at the max.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nia-ann
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, fantastic location (stones throw from Spanish Steps) and very friendly staff. What more do you need? As some other reviews state, the rooms are not massive, but they are clean, modern and really nicely finished. There was some building work going on during our stay and for 3 days we were unable to open our shutters properly, but even this didnt spoil our stay. I am usually quite picky on the hotels I stay in, but this one was really worth the money - Great value, great location and great bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Old Part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: KGACanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome at the Hotel Homs during our visit in Sept/06 & the choice was made by our travel agent. We really enjoyed our stay in the hotel but I have to warn you that no matter where you stay in this area it is very expensive but the location for touring the ruins is fantastic. The hotel is rated a 3 star & that is fitting. The people at the hotel were charming & very helpful. The Metro is close by & can be used in visiting the Colosseum & vatican although if you love to walk they can be reached, all other ruins & sites are within walking from the hotel. The hotel, bathrooms & elevators are "Quaint" but you adjust to it after awhile. There are numerous outside cafes to choose from & they are all wonderful & the drinks/food are great. The only draw back with this hotel location is getting to/from the airport very time consuming & expensive if you are staying here make sure your flight departure is between noon & 2:00 PM so you have plenty of time to get to the airport. Even with the expense my wife & I would go back to this hotel in a heart beat....

Reviews.Title: “Very unlucky choice”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2TRAVELEUROPE
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our holiday in Italy. The first night at the hotel was terrible. We checked in after 6 pm but the room given to us was at the 5th floor. Elevator was going up to 4th so you should walk from the stairs. The room was incredibly small, dirty and badly decorated. One bed, one basket. Very small and dirty bathroom. We used the lobby toilet. Asked the reception staff to change our room (even offerred money). By luck, our request is accepted. Stayed 2 more nights at a better room. No breakfast served for us. Noisy hotel. I will always remember this hotel in my worst memories. Does not worth a cent. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Dont waste your time, money and nerves.

Reviews.Title: “Less than adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Though I booked three triple rooms months ahead for this hotel online (with nycerome[--]), the hotel did not have a record of my reservation when I arrived. However, the friendly desk clerk was able to give us four doubles and a single for the same price. However, the double rooms were closet-sized with small double beds, and with barely enough room to put our suitcases on the floor. The bathroom was equally tiny, though clean. Although we had booked the Homs for three additional nights later in July following a cruise, we cancelled and found another hotel, at which we were far happier. I would rate the Homs at most a two-star hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: toskana99
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room and called the hotel a week before arrival to confirm. Needless to say, on arrival, we were booked into a double room. To be fair they offered us two singles - my mothers was next to the lift, and mine was hardly big enough to put my case on the floor and was next to the kitchen which meant a huge amount of noise. The location is excellent but I dont rate this hotel as any more than a two star and I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Homs”
Reviews.Author: balazs4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Homs has an excellent location, 1 minute from the Spanish Steps and 2 minutes from the Trevi Fountain. There are also bus stops and the metro in walking distance. The rooms are not "US-sized", but hey, it's Europe! And anyhow, you won't spend to much time in your room. The breakfast must be the best in Rome! Rome hotels don't offer a buffet breakfast (usually only a limited continental one), and surely not this quality. The hotel is currently undergoing renovation, but it doesn't disturb one's stay. Try to book a room through an Internet travel agent as it can be much cheaper than the hotel's official rates. I definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but don't go there for about 10 months!”
Reviews.Author: Geecee33
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break at Hotel Homs. The location of the hotel is excellent - just around the corner from the Spanish steps and not far from the Trevis Fountain. We had a nice corner room (but with a really tiny bath), comfy bed and linen changed daily. The breakfast was plentiful with a good selection of meats, spreads, and hot food as well. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and gave us some good suggestions for eating out (Otello is a really good place to go). Unfortunatly major renovations are going on at the moment so the place is more a building site than a hotel....SO DO NOT GO FOR THE REST OF 2006 - when they've finished the works I'm sure the place will be fab.

Reviews.Title: “good location but only OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bostongirl_MA
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple here for 2 nights during our Rome trip 3/2006. The location is fantastic, literally right around the corner and very walkable from the Spanish Steps (Spagna) subway stop-- (do not walk from the Barberini stop which is quite a trek). However, the room was incredibly small, even though our triple included a king plus 2 twins. Adequate facilities if you just want a place to rest, but didn't really feel clean. Above all, they were doing construction downstairs in the lobby which woke us up usually around 7am every day. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful, and spoke English. Breakfast upstairs on the terrace was great, with hot options and cold buffet, in a beautifully-decorated room. Overall a decent place for the location and basic amenities, but don't stay here if you want luxury.

Reviews.Title: “homs hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisjUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: just returned from my visit to the homs hotel rome italy hotel no where near a 3 or 4 star don,t stay in room 46 on top floor next door to kitchen they start breakfast at 6 15 am and wake you up with radio and banging also toilet runs all night bed is a 3/4 bed so small overall though great location right by spanish steps could,nt wait for a good nights sleep when i returned home

HotelInfo.Name: Homs Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via della Vite 71 / 72, 00187 Rome, Italy
